backText: Registration and attendance are 100% free, with meals, drinks, swag, & workshops included.
Any current high school student, grades 9–12.
If you’re under/over that age, pleasae contact us & we’ll see what we can do.

frontText: What if I’m new to coding?
backText: Complete beginners are not only welcome, but expected!
Learn as you go with our intro workshops & mentors.

frontText: What if I already know how to code?
backText: If you are an expert, let us know if you'd like to also volunteer to host a workshop. You will still have chances to win cool prizes.
Nope! You’ll have an opportunity to meet fellow hackers and make teams of up to 4 people. Find some new friends, bring yours, or work alone.

Anything! A website, app, game, hardware, you name it. We will have different categories to submit for prizes. Judges will rate projects on creativity, technical skill demonstrated, polish, & utility.
Student ID, computer, chargers, anything for your hack (hardware?). We will have some materials to use for prototypes (like arts, crafts, and building supplies) but feel free to bring your own.

frontText: Who runs this? Is it supervised?
backText: We’re independently-organized by high schoolers, sponsored via an international non-profit called Hack Club. The event is fully supervised by teachers and other volunteer adults.

frontText: I'm ready to signup! How do I register?
backText: Registration opens on September 1st and a discord channel will be created to answer questions and virtually meet other hackathon attendees.
The Hackathon theme and challenge categories for prizes will also be annouced at that time, so stay tuned for details.
